Entry.1: -In billets near Steenvoorde, fixed up all shortage for 28th.
Entry.2: -Collett returned & took over, I went back to
Entry.3:
Bn., Currie to 28th.

Saturday 13/10/17 -Stirring up things, saw Bridges at Div re "Dud" Camp.
Entry.4: -Finished letter to Doff, saw Bas who has done well.
Entry.5: - Visited all billets, went to Steenvoorde to dinner with Lloyd, applied for leave to England.
Entry.6: - Leave to England turned down, went & saw Collett re same.
Entry.7: -On Court of Inquiry re train stopping at Hell Fire Corner instead of proceeding to Birr X Roads . Dinner with Fernie.
Entry.8: -Left by train to Hazebrouck, there caught leave train, arrived at Boulogne at 2 am Friday.
Entry.9: -At Morleys for lunch after good trip across, met Hardie & had dinner with him.
Entry.10: -Spent day buying clothes and then at Wandsworth, went to the Coliseum.
Entry.11: -Went to Australian Club at Piccadilly and had lunch & dinner there with Hardie. Wrote Doff.
Entry.12: -Went to see "A Kiss or two" and then to the Bamfords for the night.
Entry.13: -Came to London in the Evening to book seats, returned with Patie to Malden.
Entry.14:
- Took Patie & Hetty to "Arlette" and then left them, went

to "Cheap" at night, saw Wisdom.
Entry.15: -Met Mr Gray & had lunch with him at Cafe Royal, saw "Romance".
Entry.16: - Went to "Fovent" to the Training Battalion, came back same night.
Entry.17: - Went out to Malden to say Goodbye to the Bamfords, had lunch with them . Had dinner with Gray & left for Scotland.
Entry.18: -Arrived at Dunkeld, had breakfast and then went to Amulree Hotel, went for a walk. Good dinner. Wrote to Doff.
Entry.19: - Dressed in kilts, went shooting grouse, not easy to hit, only got one.
Entry.20: -More shooting, left by car for Dunkeld then to Perth and got sleeper for London.
Entry.21: - Arrived at Euston at 8.45 a.m., caught train for Folkestone from Charing Cross at 11 a.m. & boat to Bolougne arriving at 4 p.m. Met Gale. Stayed night at Folkestone Hotel.
Entry.22: -Left Bologne at 9.30 arrived at Ypres at 11 p.m. tired, stayed night with Div.
Entry.23: - Left at 5.30 a.m. for Camiers for musketry demonstration with Paton & Miles, returned at 11.30 p.m., stayed night at Division.
Entry.24: -Joined Battalion, just relieved from line, at Walker Camp, some of the men slightly gassed. Two letters from Doff. Wrote to Doff. Sent Cable to Billie.
Entry.25: - Quiet day - saw Wisdom, had a game of cards.
Entry.26: - Very quiet day, raining slightly - men resting. Night raid by Huns very close.
Entry.27: -Rode to Reninghelst and had tea with Lloyd.
Entry.28: -Raining heavily all day - O'Hara Wood came along for game of cards.
Entry.29: - Orders received to move, saw Bas, had letters from Hetty & Pattie.
Entry.30: -Battalion moved by bus to Steenvoorde, I rode with Little. Had dinner to celebrate Billie's Birthday with Robinson.
Entry.31: - Quiet day - a bit off color - presumably Billie is the cause.
Entry.32: - Went for a long walk & afterwards had band playing in Steenvoorde Square.
Entry.33: -Meeting of CO's at Bde HQrs, wrote to Doff.
Entry.34: -Training, saw Corlette. Fixed up new Band master.
Entry.35: - Up at 6 a.m. & walked to Cassell 7 miles - Birdwood presented medals - Route march afternoon.
Entry.36: - Walked 5 miles before breakfast - refereed a football match - orders received to move to Neuve Eglise.
Entry.37: - Marched to Berthen via Mont Des Cats, I walked - orders received to report to Reinf Camp.
Entry.38: - Bn moved to Neuve Eglise - I to Fletre after a walk of 5 miles. Saw Div at Eeke .
Entry.39: - Walked to Neuve Eglise & had breakfast with Battalion - walked home in afternoon 19 miles.
Entry.40: - Walked to Mont Des Cats 5 miles. Inspected Camp which is in a fearful condition.
Entry.41: - Complained to Jess about Waters - posted picquets. Morning walk.
Entry.42: -Gen'l White visited the camp. Rode to Steenvoorde & had dinner there. Walk.
Entry.43: - Orders received to close camp, general clean up.
Entry.44: -Left for Division, reported through Bde & joined up Battalion. Walk.
Entry.45: - Had a good look around. Letter from Doff. Had game of H ball against 25th.
Entry.46: - Went for a walk. Church parade. Wrote to Doff.
Entry.47: -Played f/ball against M.G. Coy, scored a try. "C" Coy tactical Exercise.
Entry.48: -Raining, meeting of CO's, wrote to Doff.
Entry.49: - Played f/ball against 7th Engineers, won by 3 to nil.
Entry.50: - Saw Warwick Gregory, also visited The General's Grave at Trois Abres, went for a walk. 12 months in command.
Entry.51: - Walked to Messines. Got f/ballers out for a talk.
Entry.52: - Played 25th f/ball, defeated 8 to 6. I scored one try. Letter from Doff.
Entry.53: - Church Parade. Went for long walk to Brigade. Took charge of Raiders for Brigade. Wrote to Doff.
Entry.54: -Training of Raiders commenced. Wrote to Bas. Two great photos of Billie.
Entry.55: - Went for a long walk, had dinner with 28th€‹.
Entry.56: - Conference of C.O's at Div. H.Q.rs., went for a walk in afternoon.
Entry.57: -Reconnoitred ground for tactical Scheme with Wisdom. Col. Hind to dinner.
Entry.58: - Left for Wisques for T.M. demonstration returned at 4.30 p.m.
Entry.59: -Saw Raiders at work. Quiet Day. Wrote to Doff.
Entry.60: -Reconnoitred ground for scheme. Afternoon Address by Chaplain General . Evening Concert Brigade Very Good.
Entry.62: - Feeling a bit off color, quiet day, meeting of C.O's.
Entry.63: -Battalion Scheme. Afternoon f/ball match against 5th Bde. Had dinner with C.N. Smith with 10th F. Amb. .
Entry.64: - Reconnoitred front Line with Lloyd, going in in front of Warneton.
Entry.65: -Another trip to Front line, returned by The Shrine where the General was killed.
Entry.66: - Relieved 40th without casualties. Band went to Division. Cabled Doff.
Entry.67: - Hun fairly active throughout the day, our patrols out. Wrote Doff.
Entry.68: -Quiet day generally, men working well, have attached to me Lt Park of 102 Regt U.S.A.
Entry.69: -Very cold & frosty. Had a good look around the trenches.
Entry.70: -Hun active with Minenwerfers. One man killed.
Entry.71: - Still very cold & frosty, visited 10th Battalion.
Entry.72: - Park of USA left to rejoin his Regt. W came around the trenches.
Entry.73: -Visted by Gen'l Birdwood, men working well.
Entry.74: -Relieved by 28th at 8.20 p.m., three casualties coming out.
Entry.75: -In Catacombs, had a good sleep & a bath.
Entry.76: - Wrote to Doff wishing her a Merry Xmas. Snowing - men on fatigues.
Entry.77: -Quiet Day, wrote to Mother & Bas. Men on fatigue.
Entry.78: - Still snowing & cold. Saw Bundock of R.A.A. Men fatigues.
Entry.79: -Quiet Day but very cold, reconnoitred front near La Basse Ville.
Entry.80: - Received cable from Doff saying all well & wishing me Xmas Greetings.
Entry.81: - Hun aeroplane flew over very low. Went up to arrange for take over, again wrote to Doff.
Entry.82: -Took over from Colette again, no strafe.
Entry.83:
- Mentioned in despatches, a bit of 
enemy
 shelling on both sides.
Entry.85:
-Good patrol work done by the Battn.

Thursday
Entry.86:
Awarded bar to D.S.O. Bas & D.S.O Martin Carly.

Friday 4/1/18 - Birdwood visited line & congratulated me on D.S.O.
Entry.87: - New Huns opposite getting very active, had good old artillery duel - no casualties.
Entry.88: -More good patrol work - also good wiring work done.
Entry.89: - Quiet Day. relieved by Currie - moved by light Railway to Romarin.
Entry.90: -Saw Wisdom. Wrote Doff, am going on months leave. Letter from Birdie re guard. Went to picture Show.
Entry.91: -Had a good look around, commenced fresh Report on Lagnicourt.
Entry.92: - Orders received, Bde being relieved by 6th Bde.
Entry.93: - All arrangements made for hand over. Went to Picture Show, our band playing.
Entry.94: - Relieved by 21st Bn & we moved to Canteen Farm camp.
Entry.95: - Church Parade. Letter from Doff. Finished report on Lagnicourt.
Entry.96: - Snowing heavily all day - went to Steenwerck.
Entry.97: - Had lunch at Brigade H.Qrs. Still snowing, wrote to Doff.
Entry.98: - Going on leave tomorrow, had a talk with Robinson & Lloyd.
Entry.99: - Caught Light Railway to Steenwerck & thereby train to Calais. No boats running. Got a room at Commerce Hotel. Went to dine with a Miss Martin Y.M.C.A.
Entry.100: - Left by Boat at 9.30 a.m. Arrived at Dover, had lunch on board train. Put up at Hotel Alexandria, went to the Palladium.
Entry.101: - Took Pattie Bamford to lunch, afterwards met John Torpy. Later went to Malden.
Entry.102: - Spent Sunday with the Bamfords at Malden, returned to town about midnight.
Entry.103: - Saw Gen'l Howse, had a turkish Bath, went to "The Maid of the Mountains".
Entry.104: - Wrote to Doff and then went to Malden.
Entry.105: -Spent the day at Malden and went for a long walk.
Entry.106: - Returned to Town, saw Howse, had lunch with Gray, afterwards met Hardie - had dinner at Club.
Entry.107: - Got some new clothes finished, sent wire to Doff asking for £50 which I will repay. Went to "Romance" very good.
Entry.108: - Went out to Malden & took Hetty to matinee Valentine, returned about 6.p.m & took Pattie to local Pictures.
Entry.109: - Had a good loaf around & read a book at Malden.
Entry.110: - Lunched with Hardie, had an air raid, went to the Palladium.
Entry.111: - Another air raid, got a pair of new shoes, had tea with Mrs Gordon Vesche. Wrote to Doff.
Entry.112: - Had lunch with Gray, Reiss & Johnson (same party as at Amulree), went to a picture show. Dance at Lady Mond, Lowndes Square.
Entry.113: -Letters from Doff. Had dinner at Ritz and then went to see "Love in a Cottage" with the Grays.
Entry.114: - Again dined at the "Ritz" and then went to "Pamella" with the Grays.
Entry.115: -Went for Pattie, took her to lunch & then to Queen's Hall. Concert Dance at A/asian Club, Piccadilly at night.
Entry.116: -Went down to Bamfords for a couple of days.
Entry.117: -Received cable from Doff sent on 12/1/18. Got a new pr of Alpine boots. Wrote Doff.
Entry.118: - Still at Bamfords. Went to a picture Show "The Greatest Wish in the World".
Entry.119: -Good clean up at the Hotel, cleaned boots, belt etc. went to Dear Brutus.
Entry.120: - Took Mrs Bamford to The Yellow Ticket, very good play.
Entry.121: - Went with Bamford to Shell factory, spent whole day.
Entry.122: - Stayed at Bamfords all day & real rest.
Entry.123: - Had another good easy day - read a book at Bamfords.
Entry.124: - Came back to Hotel about noon, went to Picture Show - Queen Alexandra present. Wrote Doff.
Entry.125: -Went to see "When Knights were bold". Received letter from Doff.
Entry.126: /18 -Received proofs of photo - not much good. met Jack Playfair, had lunch & went to "A Little Bit of Fluff" with him.
Entry.127: /18- Going back tomorrow, leaving this book with Mrs Bamford tonight.
